item.title: Activision is Aware That Bizarre Skins Are Making Call of Duty ‘Look Stupid’, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/call-of-duty-skins-make-game-look-stupid/

Activision has been hellbent on jamming as many crossovers into the Call of Duty universe as possible these days. We’ve seen some bizarre topics surface, leading to inane in-game events and laughable skins that have players craving something a little more grounded.

In a recent claim from a prolific Call of Duty insider, it was suggested that Activision is acutely aware of the feedback from the wider community suggesting that Call of Duty is becoming a laughing stock because of these weird skins and irrelevant crossovers.

Self-Awareness is Key

In a post on social media, TheGhostofHope gave feedback about the performance of Warzone and how Verdansk has boosted the game’s player count on all platforms.

He then turned to talk about the future of Warzone, suggesting that Activision’s teams are proposing taking a more restrained approach to skins and bundles in the game:

They are talking about showing more restraint with Warzone for skins/bundles/microtransactions. Crossovers are ‘printing money’ but they hear the criticism that the game is starting to look stupid.

Gone are the days when people ran around Call of Duty dressed exclusively in milsim outfits. The rise of the free-to-play battle royale platform meant that microtransactions had to be ramped up, thus leaving us with countless crossovers and collaborations with musicians, television shows, movies, and other games.

They might be ‘printing money’, but perhaps die-hard Call of Duty fans are growing tired of the number of neon-lit, over-the-top, impossible outfits in the game.

Have you ever bought a ludicrous Call of Duty skin? Let me know what you purchased in the comments, or hit up the Insider Gaming forum.
